intro: Hysterobaeckea glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular hysterebace, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that appear in spring. Its leaves are narrow, leathery, and covered in tiny glands, giving it a distinctive appearance. Hysterobaeckea glandulosa is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
